column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. At times even driving 10 MPH is too fast for existing conditions.

column8: No left turn

column4: leave more space in front of their vehicle.
column8: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.

column2: 4. A yellow arrow on a traffic signal means:
column4: Be prepared to stop and give the right-of-way to oncoming vehicles.
column6: Increase your speed to make the turn before the light changes.
column8: Drivers are not required to signal before turning from that lane.

column2: 5. Service signs are ____ with ____ letters and symbols.
column8: white; green

column4: Bicycles cross or ride beside traffic
column6: Bicycles have the same rights as other vehicles
column8: Yield right-of-way to bicycles
column10: Yield to motorcyles, but not to bicycles

column4: if a driver is moving slowly, and you want them to drive faster.
column8: only when necessary, to avoid collisions.
column10: to alert other drivers that they made a mistake.

column2: 8. In general, you should pass vehicles going in the same direction as you are going:
column4: whenever you have the opportunity to do so.
column6: only if the other driver signals it is safe.
column8: on the left.
Warning, slippery when wet

column2: 10. When driving in travel lanes on the roadway:
column4: you may make back up quickly if there are no vehicles behind.
column6: you may make a U-turn if you get on the wrong entrance ramp of the freeway.
column8: you may stop to let out passengers.
column10: do not stop for any reason, keep moving until you can safely pull off the road.

column8: Railroad Crossing

column2: 12. Are bicyclists required to obey traffic laws and signs?
column6: No, bicyclists are considered pedestrians when it comes to the rules of the road.
column8: Yes, but only if they are riding in a bicycle lane.
column10: Not if they are licensed bicyclists.

column8: Divided highway ahead - stay to the right
No right turn

column2: 15. When passing another vehicle, you should return to your lane if:
column4: you are 100 feet ahead of the vehicle.
column6: you can see both headlights in the rearview mirror.
column8: you are at least 25 feet in front of the passed vehicle.
column10: you have passed the other vehicle’s front bumper.

column2: 16. To keep your vehicle from rolling into traffic when parked on a hill, if you are facing uphill you should:
column4: set the parking brake and keep the front wheels straight.
column6: turn the front wheels towards the curb or edge of the road.
column8: turn the front wheels away from the curb or edge of the road.
column10: turn the back wheels towards the curb or edge of the road.

column2: 17. When two cars arrive at an intersection with no signs or signals at the same time, which car has the right-of-way?
column4: The car in which the driver sounds the horn.
column6: The car approaching from the right.
column8: The car approaching from the left.
column10: The car that is traveling faster.

column8: one-way street ahead.

column6: when it first starts to rain.
column8: on hills.

column2: 20. If you meet a stopped school bus with the lights flashing and the signal arm extended, you should:
column6: watch for children and proceed at normal speed.
column8: proceed at 15 MPH or less, if no children are present.

column2: 21. You are driving on a four-lane divided highway, two vehicles are driving side by side ahead of you, and you are in a hurry. You should:
column4: drive closely behind the vehicle in the left lane and flash your headlights.
column6: drive closely behind the vehicle in the right lane.
column8: drive in either lane with at least a two-second time interval behind the vehicle ahead.
column10: drive closely behind the vehicles ahead changing lanes frequently.

column8: a cross road.
Exit

column4: for the first 2 hours of a rain storm.
column6: after it has been raining for an hour or more.
column8: the first rain after a dry spell.

column4: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
column8: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.
column10: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
